alert.note: Alert for Dubois (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 4:09PM EDT until August 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following county, Dubois. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jasper, Huntingburg, Holland, Maltersville, Huntingburg Airport, Bretzville, Duff, Saint Anthony and Saint Marks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
